ygData.subject: Re: Party at nWo base!
ygData.msgSnippet: The pain and the discharges gradually subside, and Phoenix, greatly weakened, slumps into Wolfenstein s arms.  Her internal computer chirps just loudly enough

The pain and the discharges gradually subside, and Phoenix, greatly 
weakened, slumps into Wolfenstein's arms.  Her internal computer 
chirps just loudly enough for Wolf to hear: "Spark containment re-
established."

The femme shakes her head.  "It's been months since that's happened," 
she says quietly.  "I was just starting to hope it had stopped for 
good."  She musters the strength to look over at Heartbreak.  "It 
wasn't your fault."  Then her head droops as she slides into stasis 
lock.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Hollywood Narrator" 
<hollywood.narrator@v...> wrote:
> Spider: Oh, come on you sissies!
> 
> He walks up.
> 
> Arrow: Spider, don't--
> 
> Spider: Quiet, Arrow, you need to learn a few things.
> 
> Spider grabs a nice firm grip on Phoenix's arm and vibrates around 
with electricity crackling through his body. Deemos looks at Arrow, 
but looks away when Arrow doesn't look back. Spider's grip stayed 
tight, however. After a few more seconds Spider's grip loosens and he 
is thrown backwards and into a wall. He falls to the floor and 
twitches, still crackling with electricity.
> 
> Deemos: Well, she isn't dead.
> 
> Arrow's glare was on Phoenix, he never bothered to check Spider's 
condition...
> 
>   ----- Original Message -----
>   From: Richard Allen
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>   Sent: Monday, February 17, 2003 3:08 PM
>   Subject: Re: Party at nWo base!
> 
> 
>   : : Heartbreak : : 
> 
>   After seeing Phoenix fall to her knees, and the odd energy appear 
HBK takes a step back. 
> 
>   Heartbreak: I didn't do it, I swear! I didn't break our toy! 
> 
>   : : Wolfenstein : : 
> 
>   Wolf sees that something is wrong with Phoenix. What had they 
done?! 
> 
>   He pushes past a few nWo members, including Heartbreak. He kneels 
in front of Phoenix, but he did not touch her. 
> 
>   Wolfenstein: Phoenix, it's Wolf. What's wrong with you? Do you 
need help? 
> 
>   Wolfenstein didn't care if he was looking weak in front of the 
boys. He wanted to help her. He really hoped she could see that he 
meant no harm. 
> 
>   The preceding has been paid for by the 
> 
>   New World Order 
> 
>    "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> wrote: 
> 
>     OOC: You underestimate the inevitable pain threshold of someone 
who's 
>     alternately been a punching bag, target practice, and 
occasionally a 
>     sex toy for nine years.  Phoenix has to be taking a huge whale 
of a 
>     beating before she actually screams in pain.  A branding torch 
>     doesn't cut it - no pun intended.
> 
>     Phoenix::
> 
>     The femme doesn't give them the statisfaction of hearing her 
scream 
>     during the branding, although several pained grunts escape her 
>     gritted teeth.  Phoenix knows how to deal with pain, and she 
focuses 
>     on anything but the burning of her own body to bear the torment 
in 
>     relative silence.
> 
>     Heartbreak's treatment is another matter.  As she lands hard on 
her 
>     back, memories surface of the things Clawful did to her, and 
Phoenix 
>     scrambles away, standing up and backing into a corner.  
Trembling, 
>     the femme tries to calm herself - there's no way it could be as 
bad 
>     as before, she rationalizes, since HBK doesn't have claws he 
could 
>     spear her to the floor with for starters.  It doesn't work - 
her mind 
>     keeps superimposing the image of the Rogue berserker over 
Heartbreak.
> 
>     Fear grips her spark compartment with an icy hand.  Seemingly 
in 
>     response to the threat, she feels her unstable mutant spark 
flare up 
>     and send hot tendrils of energy throughout her body.  Even more 
>     terrified of her own poorly understood powers than of anything 
the 
>     nWo might do to her, she tries to suppress the reaction to no 
avail.
> 
>     The first external indication that something has gone very 
wrong is 
>     when Phoenix drops to her knees, her arms wrapped around her 
chest 
>     like she's trying to keep herself from exploding, and that's 
not far 
>     from the truth.  Strange energy patterns begin sparking across 
her 
>     frame.  (Think when the BW characters get energon deep-fried, 
only 
>     the lightning is orange instead of blue.)
